decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to create a fast and aggressive strategy by using a combination of creatures with abilities that can quickly overwhelm the opponent. By utilizing cards like Llanowar Elves and Badgermole Cub to ramp up your mana, you can quickly bring out powerful creatures like Craterhoof Behemoth and Ouroboroid to deal massive damage. The inclusion of bounce spells like Bounce Off and Exclusion Mage helps to control the opponent's board and keep the pressure on. Overall, this deck aims to outpace and outmaneuver the opponent with a strong Simic aggro strategy.

This Izzet Control deck focuses on using a combination of spell cards and creatures to control the board and outlast opponents. By utilizing a mix of removal spells like Abandon Attachments and Combustion Technique, along with card draw spells like Accumulate Wisdom and Artist's Talent, the deck aims to maintain card advantage and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Key cards like Iroh's Demonstration and Stormchaser's Talent provide additional value and flexibility, while Ral, Crackling Wit serves as a win condition. Overall, the deck seeks to control the game's pace and outmaneuver opponents to victory.

The main focus of this Jeskai Control deck is to disrupt and control the opponent's strategy through various spells and card advantage. The deck includes a mix of removal spells, card draw, and counterspells to handle different threats. It also features lands that provide additional utility and mana fixing. The goal is to outlast the opponent by managing resources effectively and eventually win the game through card advantage and powerful finishers. The deck aims to control the flow of the game and dictate the pace of the match in order to come out on top.

This Aggro Simic deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana with cards like Llanowar Elves and Nature's Rhythm to bring out powerful creatures like Craterhoof Behemoth and Gene Pollinator. It also utilizes cards like Spider-Sense and Mockingbird to control the board and protect your creatures. With a mix of aggressive creatures and strategic spells, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a strong board presence and efficient mana usage to secure a quick victory.

This deck focuses on utilizing control spells and abilities to manipulate the opponent's board state while generating card advantage and tempo. By using a combination of counter spells, removal, and card draw, the player aims to outvalue their opponent and control the pace of the game. The deck also incorporates a subtheme of elemental damage, with cards like Firebending Lesson and Combustion Technique providing additional removal options and win conditions. In addition, the inclusion of unique cards like Iroh's Demonstration and Abandon Attachments adds versatility and unpredictability to the deck.

The main concept of this deck is to control the pace of the game using a mix of spells and creatures from the Izzet color combination. The deck focuses on card draw, removal, and countering opponent's spells to maintain board control. With cards like Abandon Attachments and Artist's Talent for removal, and Accumulate Wisdom for card advantage, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent while maintaining control through cards like Spell Pierce. The win condition is through overwhelming the opponent with powerful spells and creatures like Firebending Lesson and Iroh's Demonstration.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and card draw. It seeks to maintain board control while disrupting the opponent's strategy and generating card advantage. By utilizing a mix of versatile spells and powerful finishers, the deck aims to outlast opponents in the late game and secure victory through superior resources and decision-making. The inclusion of various utility lands and sideboard options further enhances its flexibility and adaptability to different matchups.

This deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana with cards like Llanowar Elves and Botanical Sanctum to bring out powerful creatures like Gene Pollinator and Craterhoof Behemoth early in the game. It also utilizes cards like Nature's Rhythm and Multiversal Passage to fix mana and accelerate plays. The inclusion of cards like Ouroboroid and Quantum Riddler provide additional synergy and value, while cards like Spider Manifestation and Badgermole Cub contribute to the aggro strategy by applying pressure on the opponent.

The main concept of this Izzet Control deck is to control the battlefield by utilizing a combination of card draw, removal spells, and powerful creatures, while also utilizing versatile land cards to fix mana and generate value. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent with card advantage and board control, slowly chipping away at the opponent's resources until it can secure a win condition. With a focus on tempo and efficiency, this deck seeks to disrupt the opponent's game plan and impose its own strategy to come out on top in the end.

This Jeskai Control deck focuses on controlling the board through removal spells like Lightning Helix and Day of Judgment, while also providing card advantage with cards like Jeskai Revelation and Meticulous Archive. The deck aims to outvalue opponents by drawing cards and efficiently dealing with threats, eventually winning through cards like Ultima or using Consult the Star Charts to find key answers. The mana base is designed to support the deck's three-color requirements, with lands like Riverpyre Verge and Sunbillow Verge providing additional utility. Overall, the deck aims to outlast opponents and grind out a victory through resource management.

This Jeskai Control deck utilizes a combination of removal spells, counter spells, and card draw to manage and control the game. With a focus on resource management and denial, the deck aims to outlast opponents and gain incremental advantages over time. By carefully controlling the board state and maintaining card advantage, the deck can establish dominance and close out games efficiently. Key cards like Jeskai Revelation and Meticulous Archive provide card advantage, while removal spells like Abrade and Day of Judgment help maintain control of the battlefield.

The main concept of this deck revolves around using a combination of control spells and card draw to outvalue and outlast opponents. By utilizing cards like Abandon Attachments and Accumulate Wisdom to control the board and draw additional resources, as well as utilizing powerful spells like Firebending Lesson and Combustion Technique to deal with threats efficiently, the deck aims to maintain board presence while denying the opponent's game plan. Additionally, cards like Multiversal Passage and Riverpyre Verge provide mana fixing and card advantage, helping to ensure the deck runs smoothly and consistently.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and card draw, while utilizing powerful creatures like Gran-Gran and Iroh's Demonstration to pressure the opponent. Monument to Endurance and Accumulate Wisdom help to grind out value in longer games, while Firebending Lesson and Combustion Technique provide efficient removal options. Abandon Attachments and It'll Quench Ya! offer additional disruption, while Spell Pierce helps protect your own threats. Boomerang Basics can provide tempo swings, and Artist's Talent can generate card advantage. The mana base includes various dual lands to ensure consistent access to both red and blue mana.

The deck focuses on utilizing a combination of control spells and card draw to outlast opponents and maintain board advantage. By leveraging a mix of removal spells like Lightning Helix and Day of Judgment, as well as card advantage engines like Consult the Star Charts and Meticulous Archive, the player can consistently disrupt their opponent's game plan while keeping their own options open. With a strong mana base provided by lands like Sunbillow Verge and Multiversal Passage, the deck aims to control the game until it can close out with powerful finishers like Ultima and Jeskai Revelation.

This Mono Green Aggro deck focuses on fast and aggressive plays using powerful early game creatures like Tifa Lockhart, Traveling Chocobo, and Sazh's Chocobo. The deck aims to quickly build a board presence with cards like Bristly Bill, Spine Sower and Mossborn Hydra while utilizing mana acceleration from Llanowar Elves and Earthbender Ascension. Snakeskin Veil provides protection for key creatures, while Escape Tunnel and Fabled Passage ensure consistent mana fixing. Additional support comes from Ba Sing Se, Badgermole Cub, and Royal Treatment to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly build a board presence and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures. By utilizing cards like Llanowar Elves and Fabled Passage to ramp up mana production, as well as Ba Sing Se and Earthbender Ascension to pump up the creatures, the deck aims to deal damage to the opponent as fast as possible. Snakeskin Veil and Escape Tunnel provide protection and evasion for the creatures, while Royal Treatment and Mossborn Hydra offer additional threats and power. The goal is to establish dominance early and maintain pressure throughout the game.
